p: Here we discuss various challenges the current seasonal flu vaccine is facing, and how a universal influenza vaccine approach through carbohydrate design to elicit broadly neutralizing antibodies (bnAbs) targeting the influenza HA glycoprotein can potentially play a role in the future of influenza prevention. Despite the first influenza vaccine being commercially available as early as 1945, influenza outbreaks continue to be a major public health concern today. It is imperative for health authorities, researchers and the pharmaceutical industry to work together on improving the efficacy of influenza vaccines.
